voting.js Script¶

_updateFavouriteCookie(id, removeBool)¶

Used to update the “Favourites” cookie by either adding or removing a song of specified id to the favourites

Arguments:
  • id (number) – the song unique id, as specified by its original index in the getAllSongs JSON
  • removeBool (boolean) – specifies whether the song should be removed from favourites (removeBool == true) or added to favourites (removeBool == false)
_submitVote(event)¶

Callback used to submit an upvote or downvote on form submission

Arguments:
  • event (Object) – the event triggered by form submission
createVoteForm(id)¶

Used to generate a form element with upvote and downvote buttons for a song of particular ID

Arguments:
  • id (number) – the song unique id, as specified by its original index in the getAllSongs JSON
Returns:

Object – formElement - the element for the created HTML form
songLengthFormat(secs)¶

Used for converting a number of seconds into a string formatted “[minutes]:[seconds]” for nice display

Arguments:
  • secs (number) – the number of seconds to convert
Returns:

string – displayString - the formatted string in “[minutes]:[seconds]” corresponding to the supplied argument
_refreshDownloaded()¶

Callback used for refreshing the “downloaded songs” table, for instance, when a new search is made

downloaded()¶

Used to construct and populate a table of downloaded songs

_queue(data)¶

Callback used to populate the table of queued songs with the server’s song queue

Arguments:
  • data (Object) – the JSON data returned from the GET request requesting song queue
queue()¶

Used to construct and populate a table of queued songs

favourites()¶

Used to construct and populate a table of songs from the user’s “favourites” cookie

playlists()¶

Used to construct and populate the fabled “playlists” menu. Does not yet/will exist after version 0.1.0

listTabCallback(name)¶

Used as a lookup table for onclick callbacks for the buttons needed in the ‘voting’ tab

Arguments:
  • name (string) – the tab name: should be one of [“Queue”,”Downloaded”,”Favourites”,”Playlists”]
Returns:

string|buttonCallback – callback - the callback relating to the given string, or the empty string “” if the ‘name’ argument is not one of the expected values
